purpose: The code appears to collect system information including MAC addresses, hostname, and user info, then sends this data to external domains for tracking purposes.
flows: MAC addresses -> Buffer -> base64 encoding -> HTTP request
anomalies: Use of hardcoded external domains for data exfiltration
Sending system identifiers to third-party servers without user consent
analysis: The code collects sensitive system information such as MAC addresses, hostname, and user details. It then transmits this data via HTTP GET requests to multiple external domains. These domains appear to be part of a tracking infrastructure. The use of base64 encoding suggests an attempt to obfuscate the transmitted data. Disabling SSL certificate verification makes the communication vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks. This behavior is typical of malicious software or tracking scripts.
